title: Doesn’t The Beatles’ White Album have too much filler? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes it does! The Beatles were way self-indulgent recording this album. Producer George Martin insisted that they should have made a selection and release a single album. But the Beatles idea was to record everything they had in mind and release this crazy, diverse, self-indulgent album filled with music.

The simple answer to that is no, and that too many quality songs were written by the four of them in 1968, that to just write them and leave them unreleased/unrecorded, or even recorded half the songs and not released at the time would not have been an option for them, so to release a double album was just an extension of what they did from 1963 up to 1965 by releasing two albums a year, but unlike in those years there are no cover versions. no pressure of touring, or anyone to stop them deciding that they should make this a single album only. Obviously I am looking at this from the perspective of the UK albums and that Magical Mystery Tour LP was not officially released in the UK until 1976. George Martin is wrong that it should have been a single album, but then which songs would have been left off, and those that did, we would now be asking why was it edited down to a single album at the time.

Not for my money. Had they not released everything, today people would be yammering about how great it would have been had they released a DOUBLE album! I’m with Paul McCartney on this: “Shut up! It’s the bloody Beatles White Album!”

Yeah, it probably does, but other than #9, what are you going to cut ? To go from two albums down to one, you are going to have to cut at least some decent stuff. Granted, if you put all the best stuff on one album, it is a much stronger and better album.

I can’t imagine any songs I would want cut off the album except the one with yoko on it. The best part of the album is that it has such a wide variety of musical sounds! If they had put out a single album instead, we the fans would be demanding a 50th anniversary edition with all of the songs left on the editing floor —- So basically the album we actually did get way back then!

Do a search of Quora queries, some thing along the lines of “if the Beatles White Album were a single disk, what songs would you include?” sift through all the duplicated posts, and make a list of each song that had been selected. I’ll bet you’ll find almost ALL of the White Album songs will had have a decent vote tally. Obviously a few less than others, but I’d be willing to bet each song will have made its way into some one’s list. Even #9. (hah, especially #9, according to some folk..) .. now if they could have included George’s “not guilty”…
No. It is great like it is. However, Revolution # 9 is a waste of space, but it is a reflection of the times when it came out. It is the only “song" on the album that I put on skip.

I suppose there are a few sub-par songs, which in my opinion are “Wild Honey Pie,” “Don’t Pass Me By,” “Yer Blues,” and “Revolution #9,” but I don’t really mind their inclusion on a double-album. After all, now I can just hit the forward/skip button, rather than getting up and lifting the needle on the vinyl version.

Yes. It would’ve been a very good, not great, single disc. I think it was a necessary pressure-release valve with all the three principle songwriters basically working as solo artists with some limited contributions from the others. As a double album, it’s just not up to the standard of the greatest band of all time.
Maybe when you had to listen to it on cassette but on digital or CD you can just skip to the ones u want. I like most of the songs at same stage but obviously some more than others.
